tagline: Identity, access, and threat detection platform for modern cloud and enterprise environments.
capabilities: Anomalous authentication detection across users, devices, and geographies
Policy-based authorization enforcement with conflict and drift detection
Adaptive risk scoring for login and API access attempts
Correlation of identity events with infrastructure and application context
Grace-period-aware alerting to reduce false positives during expected access changes
Audit-grade logging and forensic timelines for incident response

runbooks.title: Anomalous login detected
steps: Validate whether the login originates from a known device or corporate network
Check recent password resets, MFA changes, or role updates for the affected user
Review concurrent login attempts from different geographies or IP ranges
Correlate identity events with recent application or infrastructure changes
If risk score remains elevated, temporarily restrict access and notify security operations

runbooks.title: Multiple failed authentication attempts
steps: Confirm whether failures align with a misconfigured service account or automation
Inspect IP reputation and ASN history for the source addresses
Check for similar failures across other user accounts or tenants
Apply rate limiting or temporary lockout if attack patterns are detected
Escalate to incident response if coordinated behavior is observed

runbooks.title: Authorization policy conflict
steps: Identify overlapping role-based and attribute-based access policies
Review recent policy deployments or configuration changes
Simulate access decisions to determine unintended privilege grants or denials
Roll back conflicting policies if production access is impacted
Document resolution and update policy validation rules to prevent recurrence

faqs.q: How does VaultShield differentiate between benign access changes and malicious behavior?
faqs.a: VaultShield evaluates identity events using temporal context, device familiarity, network reputation, and behavioral baselines, allowing expected changes to decay while highlighting sustained or correlated anomalies.

faqs.q: Does VaultShield replace existing IAM or SSO providers?
faqs.a: No. VaultShield integrates with existing IAM and SSO systems to provide higher-level detection, correlation, and response guidance without replacing authoritative identity sources.

faqs.q: How are alerts prioritized for security teams?
faqs.a: Alerts are scored based on potential impact, confidence, and blast radius, enabling security teams to focus on high-risk events while suppressing low-confidence noise.
